apple: Presence of a stem at the top
texture with slight dimples and variations
aquarium_fish: Artificial decorations such as rocks, castles, or plants
streamlined body shape specific to fish
Closer and clearer views of individual fish
baby: absence of or very little hair
lack of full head of hair (or sparse hair)
beaver: More robust and larger body size
bed: absence of human features (e.g., limbs, face, clothing)
usually no armrests or backrest along the sides
bee: Yellow and black coloration (in many bee species)
beetle: three distinct body segments (head, thorax, abdomen)
bicycle: No cabin or seat for the driver
bottle: liquid content visible through the material
transparent or translucent material (often glass or plastic)
bowl: Often with a smooth or decorative exterior
Absence of limbs or human body outlines
Usage context: Table setting and the type of meal can also be clues (e.g., bowls for breakfast cereals, plates for main courses).
boy: Posture or body language that is traditionally considered masculine
Lack of facial hair or very minimal facial hair
Clothing traditionally associated with boys (e.g., trousers, football jerseys)
bridge: made of materials like steel, concrete, or wood
Absence of human features (e.g., eyes, mouth, hair)
bus: steering wheel (buses have steering wheels, trains do not)
Rubber tires instead of steel wheels
butterfly: typically seen resting on flowers or foliage
camel: Tail with a tuft of hair
can: Absence of turret or gun (which are present in tanks)
caterpillar: Simple eyes (ocelli) or lack of complex eyes
short, stubby head with mandibles for chewing leaves
numerous legs along the length of the body
cattle: head with eyes, ears, and a mouth
Large, imposing structure often perched on a hill
chimpanzee: Smaller overall size compared to cattle
Flat face with protruding mouth and prominent brow ridge
clock: presence of a pendulum or digital display
Smaller size compared to large structures
cloud: surrounded by atmospheric elements such as other clouds or the sun
presence of a sky or atmospheric background
couch: texture and patterns typical of furniture fabric
crab: Eight walking legs plus two claws (chelae)
crocodile: long, V-shaped snout with numerous sharp teeth
distinct osteoderms (bony plates) on the back
cup: Material: Cups are usually made of ceramics, glass, or plastic, whereas cans are typically made of aluminum.
Generally does not have a narrow neck
Design: Cups might have printed patterns, logos, or colors that differ from the uniform metallic appearance of a can.
dinosaur: Presence of bipedal stance or unique posture
usually depicted with scales or feathers
often in an outdoor, prehistoric setting
dolphin: Playful behavior: Dolphins are often seen leaping out of the water and engaging in playful activities, while sharks tend to move more steadily and with purpose.
flatfish: Paired pectoral fins on either side of the body, near the head
Dorsal and anal fins running along the edge of the body
Typically lie flat on the ocean floor
forest: natural light filtering through the trees
girl: longer hair (though not always a reliable indicator)
General demeanor or body language (which may reflect age and gender habits)
hamster: Typically seen in a cage or enclosed environment
house: Presence of a backyard or garden area
Exterior walls made of materials like brick, wood, or siding
keyboard: letters, numbers, and symbols on keys
lawn_mower: Purpose: Lawn mowers are designed for cutting grass and have grass collection bags or side-discharge chutes. Tanks are built for combat and have visible weaponry, like cannons or machine guns.
lion: Tail with a tuft at the end
lizard: Presence of a long, slender tail
man: Shorter hair (though not always the case)
More pronounced muscle definition and body structure
maple_tree: Leaves turning bright colors in autumn
Overall shape and size of the tree canopy
mountain: presence of snow or ice caps at higher altitudes
Potential presence of glaciers or alpine flora/fauna
mushroom: Lack of clothing or accessories commonly associated with humans
Lack of limbs or human-like body
Grows directly from the ground or organic material
oak_tree: Bark that can be deeply ridged or furrowed
Roots or exposed above-ground root systems
orange: organic variations in size and shape
orchid: Multiple blooms on a single spike
palm_tree: presence of coconut or date clusters (in some species)
Absence of branches along most of the trunk
Sparse or no foliage on the lower part of the trunk
pear: Size: Pears are usually much larger than mice.
skin texture (smooth or slightly rough with speckles)
pickup_truck: Elevated, hefty body structure typically higher off the ground
flatbed or open cargo area behind the cab
Open cargo bed at the rear
plain: Presence of grasses, fields, or agricultural areas
plate: small size, fitting within a few inches in diameter
May have a glossy or polished finish
poppy: Delicate, colorful petals (often red, orange, or pink)
Central dark spot or cluster of stamens
porcupine: shorter legs with strong claws for climbing
often seen in more upright and active postures
possum: Teeth: Possums have more visible canines compared to the small teeth of mice.
rabbit: Presence of a cleft upper lip
raccoon: distinct facial mask with black markings around the eyes
Ringed tail with alternating black and white bands
ray: tail that can be long and whip-like
Large pectoral fins extending like wings
road: Trees or shrubs along the roadside
surrounding infrastructure like street lights and barriers
road markings (such as lines and arrows)
rocket: Fins or stabilizing wings at the base
fins or stabilizers at the base
rose: The color and shape of the bloom
sea: absence of human-like form or silhouette
Horizon line where water meets sky
seal: Short, flipper-like limbs (seals have shorter flippers compared to dolphins' long fins)
Typically found near or in water environments
shark: Tail: Sharks have a heterocercal tail (top lobe larger than the bottom).
skin texture: Sharks have rough, sandpaper-like skin, while dolphins have smooth, rubbery skin.
shrew: Tail covered in fur or sparsely haired
skunk: Prominent white stripe(s) running from head to tail
Presence of scent glands at the base of the tail
skyscraper: Presence of modern amenities like antennas, rooftop terraces, or helipads
snail: Tentacles with eyes at the tips
Shell: Snails typically have a coiled shell on their back.
snake: smooth, dry skin (as opposed to the rough, wet skin of a shark)
presence of a head with eyes and a forked tongue
Distinct head shape with no prominent ears
spider: absence of fur and typical mammalian features
Body shape: generally more elongated or streamlined compared to the typically broader, flatter body of a crab
Absence of antennae (spiders do not have antennae, while crabs do)
squirrel: Small size compared to a wolf
Climbing behavior, often seen in trees
streetcar: pantograph or trolley pole (for connecting to overhead electric wires)
sunflower: Smaller, individual flowers within the disk
sweet_pepper: A long barrel gun or cannon
table: Variety of shapes, such as rectangular, round, or square
used for placing items, eating, or writing
telephone: Buttons for functions such as redial, hold, or speaker (for modern telephones)
Coiled cord connecting the handset to the base
Specific design elements such as rotary dial (on older models)
tiger: Characteristic black markings on the face
Four legs and paws with claws
tractor: Designed for off-road use, often seen in fields or on farms
train: Often found in rural or intercity settings
Train signal lights: Specific signaling systems along the tracks indicating train presence and movement.
platform or station in the background
Overhead electrical lines: Some trains use overhead lines for power, while tanks do not.
Platforms: Trains are often seen next to raised platforms in stations, while buses have curb-height stops.
trout: presence of a lateral line along the body
Presence of a tail fin (caudal fin)
fins (dorsal, pectoral, pelvic, anal, and caudal)
Natural coloration pattern typical of fish
tulip: Bloom size and structure: Tulip flowers are generally larger and have a more defined structure compared to the delicate appearance of poppy flowers.
Stem: Tulips have sturdy, straight stems, whereas poppies often have slender, wiry stems.
turtle: a generally rounded or oval body shape
wardrobe: doors, often with handles or knobs
Hardware elements like handles or locks
whale: blowholes on top of the head
Absence of human facial features and limbs
willow_tree: Presence of a single, prominent trunk
wolf: Eyes: Wolves have forward-facing eyes with a more intense gaze; rabbits have large, more side-placed eyes.
woman: facial features such as eyes, nose, and mouth
natural formations like cliffs and valleys
worm: **Movement Pattern**: Worms move by contracting their body segments in a wave-like motion, whereas snakes slither in a more fluid, lateral or S-shaped motion.
presence of a slimy or moist exterior
